Certain provinces charge a Harmonized Sales Tax (HST), which is a value-added tax that blends the Provincial Sales Tax (PST) and Goods and Services Tax (GST), which in turn is a federal goverment level value-added tax of 5%. Alberta, Northwest Territories, Nunavut and Yukon charge GST only; British Columbia, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Ontario and Nova Scotia charge HST; Manitoba, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, and Saskatchewan charge PST and GST separately. Rate levels for HST and PST vary between provinces and territories: excluding areas that charge the GST only, the HST and combined PST and GST range between 12% and 15%.

Certain provinces charge a Harmonized Sales Tax (HST), which is a value-added tax that blends the Provincial Sales Tax (PST) and Goods and Services Tax (GST), which in turn is a federal goverment level value-added tax of 5%. Alberta, Northwest Territories, Nunavut and Yukon charge GST only; British Columbia, New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Ontario and Nova Scotia charge HST; Manitoba, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, and Saskatchewan charge PST and GST separately. Rate levels for HST and PST vary between provinces and territories: excluding areas that charge the GST only, the HST and combined PST and GST range between 12% and 15%.

Starting from April 2018 Ministry of Finance (MoF) decided to equate communication services' VAT to that of general goods and services which is now 15%. However, this increase was staggered and not applied all at once. As such, from April 2018 communication services' VAT was increase from 5% to 9%. Other increases will be implemented in the subsequent years.

Starting from April 2018 Ministry of Finance (MoF) decided to equate communication service's VAT to that of general goods and services which is now 15%. The 10% increase was to be implemented in a staggered manner and not applied all at once. As such, from April 2018 communication services' VAT was increase from 5% to 9%. in April 2019, VAT was increased from 9% to 12%.

El IPS/Impuesto especial sobre producción y servicios no aplica para servicios de internet fijo, telefonía pública y rural, e interconexión.
El Impuesto Especial sobre Producción y Servicios no aplica para servicios de Internet fijo, telefonía pública, rural e interconexión.

Además del IVA, se cobra el  Impuesto Especial sobre Producción y Servicios (IEPS), que  es un impuesto especial que se aplica a la producción de ciertos bienes y a determinados servicios. Los servicios de telecomunicaciones estén sujetos a un impuesto de 3.0% del valor total del servicio. Sin embargo, no se aplicará este impuesto para servicios de Internet fijo y móvil, telefonía pública, rural e interconexión.
